teams.name: Indiana
teams.loan_because: We believe people around the world are connected and we can make a positive difference in others' lives.
teams.description:
Indiana is the 19th U.S. state and is located in the Midwest region of the United States of America. With over six million residents, it is ranked 15th in population and 17th in population density.

Indiana is a diverse state with a few large urban areas and a number of smaller industrial cities. It is best known for the Indianapolis 500 American automobile race, held annually over the Memorial Day weekend, and a strong basketball tradition, often called Hoosier Hysteria. Residents of Indiana are called Hoosiers. The state's name means "Land of the Indians."

Check out the distribution of our team's impact around the world: 
http://kivafolio.appspot.com/report?user=indiana

teams.name: Unitarian Universalists
teams.loan_because:
We believe in:
**The inherent worth and dignity of every person
**Justice, equity and compassion in human relations
**Acceptance of one another and encouragement to spiritual growth in our congregations
**A free and responsible search for truth and meaning
**The right of conscience and the use of the democratic process within our congregations and in society at large
**The goal of world community with peace, liberty, and justice for all
**Respect for the interdependent web of all existence of which we are a part.
teams.description:
We are UU congregations and individuals (including those who describe themselves as "active" or "backslid" or "interested friends" or "just looking") throughout the world. 
For more information on us, or to find a congregation near you, check out the main website for the Unitarian Universalist Association

teams.name: Chapman University
teams.loan_because: We feel that microloans are a great way to make a direct impact on the lives of others. These loans are a form of proactive social justice and serve to decrease the barriers currently faced by developing nations.

teams.name: 100 Women
teams.loan_because: ...we believe microloans are one way to create a world where all women and girls can live safely, with access to health, education and economic freedom.
teams.description:
100 Women enables everyday people to be involved in creating a world where all women and girls can live safely, with access to health, education and economic freedom. We do this by combining donations and knowledge to provide impactful grants. 

Our vision is to ignite women’s philanthropy through the power of collective giving, to advance the empowerment of all women.

Consider joining our Perth-based giving circle if these values appeal to you.

teams.name: Kredit Microfinance Cambodia (Formerly CREDIT)
teams.loan_because: We want to support the borrowers of Kredit Microfinance in Cambodia.
teams.description:
Our team lends to Kredit Microfinance in Cambodia!

Kredit Microfinance is one of Kiva's oldest and largest partners, with over $4 million in Kiva loans as of September 2010. To learn more about Kredit Microfinance, please visit their partner page    www.kiva.org/partners/9 or Kredit Microfinance's website     http://www.credit.com.kh/

Join our lending team and help us lend to Kredit Microfinance!

teams.name: Vision Finance Company Supporters
teams.loan_because: We support the mission of Vision Finance Company (VFC), a partner of World Vision International.  VFC targets the productive poor, typically women, in rural areas to create holistic change for entire families.
teams.description: Vision Finance Company was Kiva's first partner in Rwanda.  Members of this team support VFC and Rwandese microentrepreneurs.  We believe in the positive change that microfinance has brought about and will bring about in this country.  We support VFC's clients and Rwanda's economic development at a grassroots level.  This country is on the rise and we support the positive change that we see.

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Eastside Business Women
teams.whereabouts: Seattle area - east side (Bellevue, Kirkland, Bothell, etc.)
teams.loan_because: As women in business ourselves, we care deeply about other women in business and understand the importance of creating opportunities.   We do so among ourselves through collaboration, referrals and networking.    Through Kiva, we are able to extend our reach for creating opportunity to women around the world.
teams.description: A a community of professional women on Seattle's Eastside who are dedicated to achieving our business and personal goals through the cultivation of non-competitive relationships with each other. Our core philosophy is centered around the age-old concept that as women, we achieve our best results through collaboration, cooperation and shared vision.

teams.name: Teachers  Rock!
teams.loan_because: We want to support the teachers of the world.  Teachers too often are among the most underpaid, undervalued but incalculably important members of our societies.   We want to support teachers in both their private and professional endeavors as a way of expressing our terrific appreciation for the work that they do and the near infinite ways they give of themselves to our children.
teams.description: We are teachers, former teachers, volunteer teachers, current or former students of teachers, or simply, admirers and valuers of teachers.   We have in common that every one of us can think of at least one teacher in our lives who profoundly touched us or comforted us or inspired us or otherwise affected the ways our minds were expanded or our hearts nourished.  We deeply believe in compassion and sharing and kindness and empathy and community, and we profoundly understand that those qualities don’t evolve automatically in our youth but have to be taught.

teams.name: Team Tia - Loan Around The Globe
teams.whereabouts: Global with HQ in Murcia, España
teams.loan_because: We want to show our support for Tia by helping others around the globe. Tia wants to be able to help people and this is a wonderful way to support her.
teams.description: Tia is an eleven year old girl living in Spain who has a number of illnesses including Dilated Cardiomyopathy. We are making loans on Tia's behalf to spread Tia's love around the globe.

teams.name: Intuit
teams.loan_because: Intuit is honored to dedicate the efforts of our Kiva lending team to the memory of our friend and colleague Anne Henderson. Anne passed away in September 2010 after a long battle with cancer. She was a bright light to everyone around her and was passionate about helping entrepreneurs through Kiva. We are inspired by her compassion, and are honored to continue her efforts to alleviate poverty. Anne, you will be greatly missed.
teams.description: At Intuit, corporate social responsibility is more than just a business practice, it's a longstanding part of who we are. It's our culture. It's one of our core values: We Care & Give Back. Anyone may join and invite others to join the Intuit lending team.

teams.name: clermont state school
teams.loan_because: We care!
teams.description: A year 3/4 class

teams.name: Three Cups of Tea - CAI Supporters
teams.loan_because: we have been touched, moved, inspired, and motivated by the example of Greg Mortenson, humanitarian, peace-maker, and author of "Three Cups of Tea: One Man's Mission To Promote Peace... One School At A Time."  Please read it if you have not already done so: your life will be changed.  We also support the Central Asia Institute (CAI), and Pennies For Peace (www.penniesforpeace.org)
teams.description: We lend especially to women in Pakistan and Afghanistan, where Mortenson and CAI are active in establishing community schools in rural areas.

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe. We love India - therefore we are the Kiva Team India. We love to use the Kiva concept to provide loans in India ! http://www.kiva.org/india

teams.name: iPeace
teams.loan_because: We care and we can
teams.description:
Sharing Peace, Making A Difference. 

iPeace is not an organization. It's an organism. It's alive, and it's made out of people; It is made from you, her him, them, us and me. It is not for profit and it is not for prestige. It is for peace. Period.


iPeace is a wiki-organism that believes in unity, sharing and love. iPeace believes in the tremendous power of people, when united together, to make a true change in the world.


Sharing Peace. Making A Difference. If each one of us makes the pledge to reduce pain in out world just by a little bit, our impact will be tremendous. Fight poverty, violence, hunger or prejudice. Help our children get better education or do something for our planet. The aggregate of the little changes will make our world more peaceful.


iPeace will be a hub to ALL peace initiatives in the world. You'll be able to come here and educate yourself about what's going on and where, and also share YOUR knowledge. We will cooperate and give support to all peace initiatives, as long as they are non violent and non profit.

Bain & Company is one of the world's leading global business consulting firms, serving clients across six continents on issues of strategy, operations, technology, organization and mergers and acquisitions. Founded in 1973 on the principle that consultants must measure their success in terms of their clients' financial results, Bain's clients have historically out performed the stock market 4 to 1. With offices in all major cities, Bain has worked with over 3,900 major multinational and other corporations from every economic sector, in every region of the world. 

Bain’s business is helping to make our clients more valuable.  Our focus is on delivering results, not reports for our clients.  We emphasize practical recommendations and how to make them happen.  
Bain consultants celebrate impact, not intellectual elegance.  We are direct, practical and down-to-earth, and we always put our clients’ needs first.

teams.name: LOTUS: Lend Out To Uplift Self-sufficiency
teams.loan_because: We care about people striving to enhance their economic self-sufficiency and wish to support their entrepreneurial endeavors. It just takes one small step by each of us lending on kiva. Together we can make it easier for hard working people to get the much-needed capital to sustain and grow their business. We feel blessed to be able to support the aspirations of so many loan recipients who persevere tenaciously for a better quality of life with dignity. Kudos to Kiva.org that allows us to connect for this common cause.
teams.description:
In our team, we have a vision to change lives in novel ways. Our team's origin began with a Kiva Card (gift certificate) whose recipient founded this team. Inspired by Kiva Fellow, Jessica Heinzelman's talk, our founder dreamed to take us on a cruise, beyond the realm of lending targets and team statistics. Frequent & occasional lenders are free to choose who to lend to, how much and when in an amiable team ambience nurtured by Kiva Fellows, Kiva Editor & Translators, artists, writers, entrepreneurs, workers, retired people, families, parent + kid(s), students, teachers, and professionals. Our diversity & portfolio enable our discovery of social values inherent in the Kiva micro-lending ecosystem whose issues we debate objectively. Experienced members are gratified to enhance our grasp of nuances in lending. We wish to work with volunteers in the team, Kiva Friends, http://kivafriends.org and our supporters to engage in activities that promote Kiva. Our journey to strengthen and grow the Kiva ecosystem has room for more. JOIN NOW, and check out our team, to convince yourself that it can be your team too.

LINKS TO SEE ALSO:
1. Kiva Updates:http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva 
2. KF Blogs:http://www.kiva.org/updates/fellows 

(Thanks Anh D Pham for letting LOTUS team on Kiva to use the exquisite image of the lotus flower you photographed in Vietnam)

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: { Kiva Fellows & Alumni }

teams.name: Vision Finance Company Supporters
teams.loan_because: We support the mission of Vision Finance Company (VFC), a partner of World Vision International.  VFC targets the productive poor, typically women, in rural areas to create holistic change for entire families.
teams.description: Vision Finance Company was Kiva's first partner in Rwanda.  Members of this team support VFC and Rwandese microentrepreneurs.  We believe in the positive change that microfinance has brought about and will bring about in this country.  We support VFC's clients and Rwanda's economic development at a grassroots level.  This country is on the rise and we support the positive change that we see.

teams.name: BRAC Tanzania
teams.loan_because:
We believe that BRAC Tanzania is empowering Tanzanian women to lift themselves and their families out of poverty. 


We want to show our support for an organization that approaches poverty alleviation from a holistic viewpoint, providing a range of programs to enable women to be agents of change.


More than this, we loan because we want to support these Tanzanian women with loans from around the world!
teams.description:
The BRAC Tanzania lending team is for anyone who is interested in Tanzania, BRAC, or BRAC Tanzania!


If you've heard of BRAC, you know that they are enabling positive change in many countries across Asia, the Middle East, and Africa. If you haven't heard of BRAC, check it out here:


http://www.brac.net/
and here:
http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=102


This team is specifically designed for BRAC Tanzania, which supports Tanzanian women through microfinance and other programs. 


Join us!!

teams.name: Safe Girls Team
teams.loan_because: By empowering girls and women in the fight for women's rights, poverty reduction, education and health promotion, we are helping to create a fairer and better world for everyone.
teams.description:
This team supports the work of Kiva, improving the lives of people around the world who have limited financial means, and who would not otherwise have the means to improve their lives, those of their families, and their communities.

We also raise awareness of the issues of  violence against girls and women including fgm, education, maternal health and human rights.

This month we deal with the issue of Human Trafficking, a problem fuelled by poverty, and one which affects millions of women and children every year.

 A video explanation of what Trafficking is:

www.no-trafficking.org/

 A personal account:

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7243612.stm

Videos:

www.theguardian.com/global-development/audioslideshow/2013/dec/11/human-cost-sex-trafficking-prostitution-audio-slideshow

www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18144333

This four week free of charge course on Human Trafficking begins on 20th August, 2014.

www.coursera.org/course/humantrafficking

 Detailed information about child trafficking:

www.childtrafficking.com/Content/sitemap.php

 To report a trafficking crime:

 In the USA:

www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/civilrights/human_trafficking

 In the UK:

https://crimestoppers-uk.org/get-involved/our-campaigns/national-campaigns/human-trafficking

Courses our team members might be interested in joining for free: 

Coursera:     
                                              
https://www.coursera.org/course/water 26th May, 2014

Edx:

Resilience https://www.edx.org/course/uwashingtonx/uwashingtonx-ecfs311x-becoming-resilient-1652#.UznR_Gco-M9  6th May,2014


We have been informed that “It is against Kiva’s terms of use http://www.kiva.org/legal/terms to use team message boards or personal lender pages for self-promotion or to solicit funding for things not related to Kiva.”

For anyone needing further information about Kiva's policy on people requesting money for themselves, other individuals or organisations on Kiva web pages please contact Kiva.

Safe Girls Team Captains.

teams.loan_because: We think Kiva is a unique opportunity for people all over the world to assist entrepreneurs in improving their businesses and communities.
teams.description: We are European lenders (EU, EFTA, and all those who feel they belong) who share the belief in Kiva's vision.

teams.name: Atheists, Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists and the Non-Religious
teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

teams.name: Bouvet Island
teams.loan_because: This is a great opportunity for us to put Bouvet Island on the map (or rather make people aware that it is on the map) while participating in a great project we really believe in.
teams.description:
We are a group of people who want to bring the most remote island in the world into the warmth of the Kiva community.
You are all welcome to join!

teams.name: Iceland
teams.loan_because: We believe in entrepreneurial spirit and want to make our contribution to make the world a better place.
teams.description:
Iceland is a European island country in the North Atlantic Ocean. Our country is volcanically and geologically active, our most famous volcano being Eyjafjallajökull, which erupted in 2010 and made the headlines worldwide. 

Iceland has a total population of only about 320,000 but even though we are few we are proud of being independent and we are always willing to help those that are in need.

teams.name: Trinity Lutheran Seminary
teams.loan_because: it is a way to live out the fact that Jesus is Lord - and He called us to love our enemies, do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return (Luke 6:35)
teams.description: a group of students, staff, faculty, and alumni at a seminary of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America

teams.name: Indiana
teams.loan_because: We believe people around the world are connected and we can make a positive difference in others' lives.
teams.description:
Indiana is the 19th U.S. state and is located in the Midwest region of the United States of America. With over six million residents, it is ranked 15th in population and 17th in population density.

Indiana is a diverse state with a few large urban areas and a number of smaller industrial cities. It is best known for the Indianapolis 500 American automobile race, held annually over the Memorial Day weekend, and a strong basketball tradition, often called Hoosier Hysteria. Residents of Indiana are called Hoosiers. The state's name means "Land of the Indians."

Check out the distribution of our team's impact around the world: 
http://kivafolio.appspot.com/report?user=indiana

To see a map showing where Indiana team members are located, click the link below.

teams.name: Team Obama
teams.loan_because: We understand that our combined efforts through Kiva will help make this world a much better place!
teams.description: http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127545645

teams.name: University Of Central Florida
teams.description: UCF Students, Alumn, Faculty and Fans

teams.name: KivaFriends.org
teams.loan_because: we are a diverse group of people with diverse reasons for participating on Kiva.org, but with a unifying desire to alleviate poverty around the world through making microloans to the hard working poor.
teams.description: We are a community for lenders by lenders. We welcome Kiva.org lenders to participate in our lender forums at KivaFriends.org

teams.name: India
teams.loan_because: "What we should aim at is the creation of people power, which is opposed to the power of violence and is different from the coercive power of state." - Vinoba Bhave
teams.description:
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty.

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe. We love India - therefore we are the Kiva Team India. We love to use the Kiva concept to provide loans in India ! http://www.kiva.org/india

Funding loans from India: http://www.kiva.org/lend?countries=IN

http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva/2012/08/15/kiva-launches-in-india.html

teams.name: Imani Works
teams.loan_because: ...we are neighbors.  When one does well, we all do well.
teams.description: Imani Works is a community of people dedicated to promoting human rights as expressed in the United Nation’s Universal Declaration of Human Rights.  We are working to empower all people to live in a sustainable, just and peaceful manner.  It is our belief that through cooperative efforts and positive social change we can help people achieve their highest potential.

teams.name: Episcopal Church in the United States
teams.loan_because: As Episcopalians, we are followers of Jesus Christ, our Lord, and believe in the Father, Son and Holy Spirit.  We strive to love our neighbors as ourselves and respect the dignity of every person.
teams.description: The Episcopal Church is part of the worldwide Anglican Communion, and traces its heritage to the beginnings of Christianity.  We celebrate our unity in Christ while honoring our differences, always putting the work of love before uniformity of opinion. We believe in amendment of life, the forgiveness of sin, and life everlasting.  All are welcome to find a spiritual home in the Episcopal Church.
